p: The phylogenetic analysis based on the species from the genus Lantana (A), Glandularia (B), Junellia (C), and Lippia (D) demonstrated separation of the three branches into four principal clusters with 83%, 93%, 85%, and 96% bootstrap, respectively. In the Lantana group, Lippia lupulina (L165) and Lippia alba (L120, L121, L122, L128), divided into subgroups with a bootstrap of 71% and 83%, respectively, were also identified. The group of Glandularia and Junellia was clearly subdivided into two groups: one belonging to the species of Glandularia and another to the Junellia subgroup.
